pullRequest.body:
add the ideal of compactly supported function and introduce the notations.

Motivation: the space of compactly supported functions may have different topologies. For the uniform norm, it was suggested to define it as a subtype of `α →ᵇ γ` [on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/variations.20of.20Urysohn's.20lemma/near/436722420)

Maybe I should add a similar subtype to `ZeroAtInfty`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: @Rida-Hamadani thanks for your suggestions! I committed them all.

### PR summary [6e2e85179e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12629/commits/6e2e85179eae294b64be1517d59f16f56f881c70)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousFunction.BoundedCompactlySupported`|1305|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasCompactMulSupport.inv'`
`+ HasCompactMulSupport.one`
`+ compactlySupported`
`+ compactlySupported_eq_top`
`+ compactlySupported_eq_top_iff`
`+ compactlySupported_eq_top_of_isCompact`
`+ every`
`+ exist_norm_eq`
`+ instance : SMul C(α, γ) C_cb(α, γ)`
`+ mem_compactlySupported`
`+ mem_top`
`+ norm_lt_iff_of_compactlySupported`
`+ norm_lt_iff_of_nonempty_compactlySupported`
`+ ofCompactSupport`
`+ ofCompactSupport_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
wow, you reduced so many lines, thank you!

I had to change the name `HasCompactSupport.neg` to `HasCompactSupport.neg'`, because it conflicted with `IsCompact.neg` in [HasCompactSupport.hasFDerivAt_convolution_right](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Convolution.html#HasCompactSupport.hasFDerivAt_convolution_right)

Since the last review, we actually have [TwoSidedIdeal](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Basic.html#TwoSidedIdeal) now, and the convenience constructor [TwoSidedIdeal.mk'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TwoSidedIdeal/Basic.html#TwoSidedIdeal.mk'). Would you mind merging master and switching to that? Sorry to have you do the work twice.

Thanks for the review!
I defined `TwoSidedIdeal`, sorry that it took me a long time.
@yoh-tanimoto what is your current plan for this PR? Are you going to continue working on it? If not, do you want to add the `please-adopt` label to hand it off to someone else?

@j-loreaux sorry that I have been silent, I was busy. I hope to restart slowly, is it fine if it takes a couple of weeks, including the other PRs? I'll keep in mind that if I'm unable to do that, I will put the tag `please-adopt`.

@yoh-tanimoto that's no problem! Take some time. We're mainly just trying to make sure that contributors know what the next steps are, and how to get things ready for merging. But we completely understand that you may be busy.
thanks for your reviews and sorry for somewhat unorganized commit (but actually I did not intend it for review yet, indeed I did not remove the `awaiting-author` tag).

ok now I added `norm_lt_iff_of_compactlySupported` and `norm_lt_iff_of_nonempty_compactlySupported`. I didn't know how to use the corresponding lemmas for `α →ᵇ γ` with `Compact α`, as in this case I needed `exist_norm_eq`.

> but actually I did not intend it for review yet, indeed I did not remove the `awaiting-author` tag.

Sorry, my fault. Next time I will wait. I've marked `awaiting-author` again as I think this should move to a new file.

> ok now I added `norm_lt_iff_of_compactlySupported` and `norm_lt_iff_of_nonempty_compactlySupported`. I didn't know how to use the corresponding lemmas for `α →ᵇ γ` with `Compact α`, as in this case I needed `exist_norm_eq`.

You would have to use the `eq_top` lemma you proved, but I think it's fine to not add these versions with `Compact α`.

:v: yoh-tanimoto can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

thank you very much for you review!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10790854325/job/29926962646)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10790854325/job/29926963489)

Thanks for all your work on this! Sorry it took so long to finally get it in. Just one or two last comments. Please merge master and then wait until CI finishes to summon bors.

bors d+

You'll need these two lemmas, which don't seem to exist currently.
```lean
@[simp]
protected lemma HasCompactSupport.zero {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [Zero β] :
    HasCompactSupport (0 : α → β) := by
  simp [HasCompactSupport, tsupport]

protected lemma HasCompactSupport.neg {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [SubtractionMonoid β]
    {f : α → β} (hf : HasCompactSupport f) :
    HasCompactSupport (-f) := by
  simpa only [HasCompactSupport, tsupport, support_neg'] using hf
```

You'll need these two lemmas, which don't seem to exist currently.
```lean
@[simp]
protected lemma HasCompactSupport.zero {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [Zero β] :
    HasCompactSupport (0 : α → β) := by
  simp [HasCompactSupport, tsupport]

protected lemma HasCompactSupport.neg {α β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [SubtractionMonoid β]
    {f : α → β} (hf : HasCompactSupport f) :
    HasCompactSupport (-f) := by
  simpa only [HasCompactSupport, tsupport, support_neg'] using hf
```

@yoh-tanimoto what else would you like to include in this PR to get the basic API off the ground? For example, some things you might consider:

1. a lemma guaranteeing that the norm is attained for `f : α →ᵇ γ` with `f ∈ C_cb(α, γ)`.
3. `C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤` in the presence of a `CompactSpace α` instance. I would prefer this *not* to be marked `@[simp]`
4. `C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤ ↔ IsCompact (Set.univ : Set α)`
5. Constructors for `α →ᵇ γ` obtained by multiplying a bounded continuous function by a continuous function (not necessarily bounded) with compact support on the left / right, along with proofs that these land in `C_cb(α, γ)`. (Potentially, this may want to wait for the type of "continuous functions with compact support" in its own right, instead of the unbundled version that would need to exist now.)
Can you add analogues of `BoundedContinuousFunction.norm_lt_iff_of_compact` and `BoundedContinuousFunction.norm_lt_iff_of_nonempty_compact` too please?
Sorry, I had pending comments.

Thanks for all your work on this! Sorry it took so long to finally get it in. Just one or two last comments. Please merge master and then wait until CI finishes to summon bors.

bors d+

```suggestion
variable {𝕜 : Type*} [NormedField 𝕜] [TopologicalSpace α] [NormedRing γ]
```

```suggestion
    intro _ _ h₁ h₂
    exact h₁.add h₂
```

```suggestion  
  zero_mem' := by simp [HasCompactSupport, tsupport]
```

```suggestion
    intro _ _ h
    rw [mem_setOf_eq, smul_eq_mul, coe_mul]
    exact h.mul_left
```
Can you implement this as a `RingCon` instead of an `Ideal` (which is only a left-ideal)? We're planning to use that for two-sided ideals.

sorry, I know this is not specific to mathlib, but I need to sync the branch to `master` because `RingCon` has been separated. How can I do that? I tried to rebase the branch to locally but cannot push it. If I merged master to this branch, there would be thousands of commits made in the meantime...
Just merge master.
ok, done
I know you did this because you saw it elsewhere, but I don't think we need both notation. Can you just remove this one and remove the priority assignment on the other?
I'm not sure if I understood correctly: you would like that `CompactlySupportedBoundedContinuousFunction` to be `RingCon`, not `Ideal`, right? Is this notation still OK?

You should learn `rintro` and its `rfl` syntax. It's a great way to simplify things.
```suggestion
    refl := fun _ ↦ ⟨0, by simp, by simp⟩
    symm := by
      rintro x y ⟨z, hz, rfl⟩
      exact ⟨-z, HasCompactSupport.neg hz, by simp⟩
    trans := by
      rintro x y z ⟨w1, hw1, rfl⟩ ⟨w2, hw2, rfl⟩
      exact ⟨w1 + w2, HasCompactSupport.add hw1 hw2, by rw [add_assoc, add_comm w2]⟩ }
  add' := by
    rintro w x y z ⟨a, ha, rfl⟩ ⟨b, hb, rfl⟩
    exact ⟨a + b, HasCompactSupport.add ha hb, add_add_add_comm ..⟩
  mul' := by
    rintro w x y z ⟨a, ha, rfl⟩ ⟨b, hb, rfl⟩
    refine ⟨a * z + a * b + x * b, ?_, by noncomm_ring⟩
    refine HasCompactSupport.add (HasCompactSupport.add ?_ ?_) <| HasCompactSupport.mul_left hb
    all_goals exact HasCompactSupport.mul_right ha
```

Sorry for the confusion, we don't need both. And the point is that we now have some convenience constructors for `TwoSidedIdeal`, so you don't need to construct and honest-to-god `RingCon` for yourself, even though it's implemented that way under the hood. Here is all we need instead of these two separate declarations.

Also, note that we're already in the `BoundedContinuousFunction` namespace, so no need to repeat that in the name.
```suggestion
/-- The two-sided ideal of compactly supported functions. -/
def compactlySupported : TwoSidedIdeal (α →ᵇ γ) :=
  .mk' {z | HasCompactSupport z} .zero .add .neg' .mul_left .mul_right
```

```suggestion
  "C_cb(" α ", " γ ")" => compactlySupported α γ
```

```suggestion
section CompactlySupported
```

```suggestion

lemma mem_compactlySupported {f : α →ᵇ γ} :
    f ∈ C_cb(α, γ) ↔ HasCompactSupport f :=
  TwoSidedIdeal.mem_mk' {z : α →ᵇ γ | HasCompactSupport z} .zero .add .neg' .mul_left .mul_right f

end CompactlySupported
```

With slight modifications, this all works in non-unital rings, and you don't want `α γ` to be explicit everywhere
```suggestion
/-- The two-sided ideal of compactly supported functions. -/
def compactlySupported (α γ : Type*) [TopologicalSpace α] [NonUnitalNormedRing γ] :
    TwoSidedIdeal (α →ᵇ γ) :=
  .mk' {z | HasCompactSupport z} .zero .add .neg' .mul_left .mul_right
  
variable {α γ : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] [NonUnitalNormedRing γ]
```

You should learn to take advantage of Lean's "generalized field notation" (a.k.a. "dot notation"). It can greatly reduce the total number of characters you have to write. Also, `refine` is your friend. And you were missing the very helpful `BoundedContinuousFunction.norm_le` lemma.
```suggestion
  by_cases hs : (tsupport f).Nonempty
  · obtain ⟨x, _, hmax⟩ := mem_compactlySupported.mp h |>.exists_isMaxOn hs <|
      (map_continuous f).norm.continuousOn
    refine ⟨x, le_antisymm (norm_coe_le_norm f x) (norm_le (norm_nonneg _) |>.mpr fun y ↦ ?_)⟩
    by_cases hy : y ∈ tsupport f
    · exact hmax hy
    · simp [image_eq_zero_of_nmem_tsupport hy]
  · suffices f = 0 by simp [this]
    rwa [not_nonempty_iff_eq_empty, tsupport_eq_empty_iff, ← coe_zero, ← DFunLike.ext'_iff] at hs
```
How do the notations `|>` and `<|` work, could you give some references?

I can't find a reference right now, but basically they mean this:

+ `‹beginning of line› ... |> ...` means `(‹beginning of line› ...) ...`
+ `... <| ... ‹end of line›` means `... (... ‹end of line›)`.

This is not *quite* accurate, because, for example, parentheses can override them. For instance `(a <| b c) d` means `(a (b c)) d`.
I see, thanks!

This gives you the lattice structure on `TwoSidedIdeal`, so you don't need to coerce `⊤` to `Set`. But actually, the fact that we need to add these imports means that we should just start a new file.
```suggestion
import Mathlib.RingTheory.TwoSidedIdeal.Lattice
```
Should I move the contents to a new file? Is it always so when one adds a new import?

It's not *always* the case, but it can be a red flag. In this case, we're adding some new imports (although only 3 new files transitively) to a file that is *already* 1500 lines long, and these imports are only used sparingly in that file.

Yes, I would move the contents to a new file. Maybe `Topology.ContinuousFunction.BoundedCompactlySupported`
OK, I created a new file.

This is misnamed, and the proof can be golfed significantly without loss in readability. (note also `⊤ : TwoSidedIdeal (α →ᵇ γ)` in this version)
```suggestion
theorem compactlySupported_eq_top_of_isCompact (h : IsCompact (Set.univ : Set α)) :
    C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤ :=
  eq_top_iff.mpr fun _ _ ↦ h.of_isClosed_subset (isClosed_tsupport _) (subset_univ _)
```

Also misnamed, and misindented, and similar comments. Also, please try to keep the conclusion on one line, when possible.
```suggestion
theorem compactlySupported_eq_top [CompactSpace α] : C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤ :=
  compactlySupported_eq_top_of_isCompact CompactSpace.isCompact_univ
```

This needs to be adapted to non-unital rings, but the adapation isn't hard. We just use `Nontrivial R` as the assumption instead. Again, the point in the `→` direction is that there exists a bounded continuous function which is nonzero everywhere (a constant function).
```suggestion
theorem compactlySupported_eq_top_iff [Nontrivial γ] :
    C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤ ↔ IsCompact (Set.univ : Set α) := by
  refine ⟨fun h ↦ ?_, compactlySupported_eq_top_of_isCompact⟩
  obtain ⟨x, hx⟩ := exists_ne (0 : γ)
  let f : α →ᵇ γ := const α x
  have hf : f ∈ C_cb(α, γ) := by rw [h]; trivial -- missing `TwoSidedIdeal.mem_top` simp lemma
  convert (mem_compactlySupported.mp hf).isCompact
  rw [eq_comm, Set.eq_univ_iff_forall]
  exact fun _ ↦ subset_tsupport _ <| by simpa [f]
```
These don't comport with the style guide or naming conventions. And also, I'm not sure we want the `SMul` instance below. I'll consider it when I revisit this PR.

```suggestion

/- This is intentionally not marked `@[simp]` to prevent Lean looking for a `CompactSpace α`
instance every time it sees `C_cb(α, γ)`. -/
theorem compactlySupported_eq_top [CompactSpace α] : C_cb(α, γ) = ⊤ :=
  compactlySupported_eq_top_of_isCompact CompactSpace.isCompact_univ
```

I think we probably want an unbundled version of this instead, i.e., `f : α →ᵇ γ`, `hf : f ∈ C_cb(α, γ)`, `g : α → γ`, `hg : ContinuousOn g (tsupport f)`, which should be both more usable, and has weaker assumptions.
done.

I think (a), this should be more unbundled, and (b), it should just be a constructor for a bounded continuous function. Note: we leave `g` explicit so that this doesn't show up in the infoview as `ofCompactSupport _ _`.
```suggestion
lemma ofCompactSupport (g : α → γ) (hg₁ : Continuous g)
    (hg₂ : HasCompactSupport g) : α →ᵇ γ := by
```
Then it should be followed by a lemma like:
```lean
lemma ofCompactSupport_mem (g : α → γ) (hg₁ : Continuous g)
    (hg₂ : HasCompactSupport g) : ofCompactSupport hg₁ hg₂ ∈ C_cb(α, γ) := sorry
```
I *think* this is actually okay, despite my previous misgivings.

It's generally easier if you use dedicated "or" statements with obtain.
```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun hn x ↦ lt_of_le_of_lt (norm_coe_le_norm f x) hn, ?_⟩
  · obtain (he | he) := isEmpty_or_nonempty α
    · simpa
    · obtain ⟨x, hx⟩ := exist_norm_eq h
      exact fun h ↦ hx ▸ h x
```

I think this case split is slightly easier (as it's what I did in my head), but this is optional.
```suggestion
  obtain (hM | hM) := lt_or_le 0 M
  · exact norm_lt_iff_of_compactlySupported h hM
  · exact ⟨fun h ↦ False.elim <| (h.trans_le hM).not_le (by positivity),
      fun h ↦ False.elim <| (h (Classical.arbitrary α) |>.trans_le hM).not_le (by positivity)⟩
```

please add the missing `simp` lemma, then it can just be `(by simp [h])` there. Note how you can specify the implicit argument `f` with the `(f := ...)` syntax.
```suggestion
  simpa [tsupport, Function.support_const hx]
    -- missing `TwoSidedIdeal.mem_top` simp lemma
    using (mem_compactlySupported (f := const α x).mp (by rw [h]; trivial)).isCompact
```

Again, using the dedicated `Set.eq_empty_or_nonempty` simplifies a lot. Also, there are a few convenience lemmas lying around, like this `dist_le_two_norm'`.
```suggestion
    obtain (hs | hs) := (tsupport g).eq_empty_or_nonempty
    · exact ⟨0, by simp [tsupport_eq_empty_iff.mp hs]⟩
    · obtain ⟨z, _, hmax⟩ := hg₂.exists_isMaxOn hs <| hg₁.norm.continuousOn
      refine ⟨2 * ‖g z‖, dist_le_two_norm' fun x ↦ ?_⟩
      by_cases hx : x ∈ tsupport g
      · exact isMaxOn_iff.mp hmax x hx
      · simp [image_eq_zero_of_nmem_tsupport hx]
```

I don't think this lemma is adding much value, and there's no real reason to require `f ∈ C_cb(α, γ)` over `HasCompactSupport f` (or `HasCompactSupport g`, for that matter). You can just inline the proof below where you needed it.
```suggestion
```

untested, but something like this should work:
```suggestion
      refine HasCompactSupport.mul_left ?_
      simp only [SetLike.coe_mem, mem_compactlySupported]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/ContinuousFunction/Bounded): add the ideal of compactly supported functions
